translation: Good man Ānanda then adjusted his clothes, knelt on his right knee, and knelt down long enough to ask, "For more than 20 years since I've been in his service, I've never seen the Buddha practice without relying on something; what are the causes and conditions for turning around and looking at the door and smiling?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是如是。
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 佛之儀法不妄迴身虛而笑也。
translation: The Buddha's manner doesn't falsely evolve into a body that's empty and smiling.

source_sentence: 是我最後見維耶離，故視笑耳。」
translation: It's because I last saw Vaiśālī that I looked at him and laughed."

source_sentence: 於是佛自頌曰：「是吾之最後，　　遊觀維耶離，　將遊彼泥洹，　　不復受有身。」
translation: The Buddha then praised himself, "This is the last time I'll wander around and look at Vaiśālī, and I'll wander into his nirvāṇa and never again experience a body."

source_sentence: 有異比丘，亦讚頌曰：「佛稱此末後，　　身行極於斯，　若遂淪清虛，　　於何覩聖來？」
translation: Some other monks also praised him, saying, "The Buddha called this the very last, and his physical conduct was so thorough that if he had ended up in the clear sky, how would he have met the noble ones?"

source_sentence: 佛與阿難俱到拘利止城北林樹下，告諸比丘：「當護淨戒，當思定意，當解智慧。
translation: The Buddha and Ānanda went together under a tree in the northern forest of Kulika and told the monks, "You must guard the pure precepts, contemplate concentration, and understand wisdom.

source_sentence: 夫以守戒，有定慧者，成大德致豐譽，永離貪婬、瞋恚、愚癡，可得應真，欲以現世望正度者，當加自解，令盡是生，入清淨道。
translation: Those who observe precepts and have concentration and wisdom will achieve great virtue and renown, will be permanently free of craving, ill-will, and foolishness, and will attain the truth. Those who want to hope for right salvation in the present life should add their own understanding, so that they will end this life and enter the pure path.

source_sentence: 已如應行，乃自知身，後不復受。」
translation: Once you've done so, you'll know your own body and won't be subject to it again in the future."

source_sentence: 佛復請賢者阿難，俱之健持邑，止城北樹下坐。
translation: The Buddha then invited the good man Ānanda and Anāthapiṇḍada to sit under a tree to the north of the city.

source_sentence: 告諸比丘：「當守淨戒，思惟定意，求解智慧。
translation: He told the monks, "You must observe the pure precepts, contemplate their concentration, and seek to understand their wisdom.

source_sentence: 守淨戒者不隨三態，惟定意者心不放散，已解慧者去離受欲，行無罣礙。
translation: Those who observe pure precepts don't follow the three states, those who concentrate their thoughts don't scatter their minds, and those who have attained the wisdom of understanding depart from sensory desires and have no obstructions in their conduct.

source_sentence: 有戒定慧，德大豐譽，又離三垢，終得應真。
translation: With precepts, concentration, and wisdom, their virtue is great and rewarding, and they're free of the three defilements and will eventually attain their truth.

source_sentence: 欲以是身望得正度，當勤求解，令盡是生，入清淨道。
translation: Those who want to achieve right salvation with this body should diligently seek to understand it, so that they can end this life and enter the pure path.

source_sentence: 作如應行，乃自知滅，後不復受。」
translation: Doing as they should, they'll know for themselves that they've ceased and won't be subject to it again."

source_sentence: 佛又與阿難俱，過掩滿邑，及出金邑、授手邑、華氏邑，至善淨邑。
translation: The Buddha also went with Ānanda, passed through the town of Cāmuṇḍā, went out of the town of Gold, the town of Hand-transfer, and the town of Flower, and reached the town of Good and Pure.

source_sentence: 處處為弟子說此三要曰：「當護戒，當思定，當解慧。
translation: He taught these three essentials to his disciples everywhere, saying, "You must guard precepts, contemplate concentration, and understand wisdom.

source_sentence: 守此三者，德豐譽大，消婬怒癡，是謂正度。
translation: Keeping these three things will give them great virtue and honor, and they will eliminate lust, anger, and delusion, which is called right ascertainment.

source_sentence: 已有戒心則定心成，定心已成則智心明，如染淨潔受色明好，有此三心則道易得，但當一意勤身求解，令盡是生已入清淨。
translation: Once the mind of precepts exists, the mind of concentration becomes accomplished, and once the mind of concentration has been accomplished, the mind of wisdom becomes clear, as defilement and purity are experienced in form and beauty, and with these three minds the path is easy to attain.

source_sentence: 行如應者，自知極此，不復受生。
translation: Those who practice as they should will know on their own that they've reached the end of this, and they won't be subject to birth again.

source_sentence: 若不能具戒定慧行，欲度世難。
translation: If he doesn't cultivate the practice of morality, meditation, and wisdom, it's difficult for him to escape the world.

source_sentence: 有此三者意自開解，坐而思惟便見五道——天上、人中、地獄、畜生、鬼神——分明，悉知眾生意志所念。
translation: With these three things enlightened in mind, he sits down and reflects on them, then he sees the five destinies-heaven, humans, hell, animals, and ghosts-clearly and thoroughly knows what the wills of sentient beings are thinking.

source_sentence: 譬如溪水清，其中沙礫，青黃白黑，所有皆見；得道之人，但心清故，所視悉見，欲得道者，當淨其中心。
translation: It's like a stream that's clear, in which sand and gravel, blue, yellow, white, and black, are all visible; someone who has attained the path can see everything they look at simply because their mind is clear, and those who want to attain the path should purify their center.

source_sentence: 如水渾濁，則無所見，持心不淨，不得度世。
translation: If the water is turbid, then there's nothing to see, and if he doesn't keep his mind pure, he won't be able to cross over to the world.

source_sentence: 師所見說，弟子當行，師同不入弟子心中，就正其念，念意端者道自得矣。」
translation: The teacher sees and teaches what the disciple should do, and the teacher doesn't enter the disciple's mind in the same way, so he corrects his mindfulness; when his mindfulness is correct, the path will be attained naturally."

source_sentence: 佛已樂善淨，又請賢者阿難，俱之夫延邑，止城北樹下坐。
translation: Once the Buddha had enjoyed his good purification, he invited the good man Ānanda and his companions to sit under a tree in the northern part of the city.

source_sentence: 晡時，阿難從燕坐起，到佛所稽首畢，叉手問曰：「倉卒欲知地動幾事？」
translation: In the afternoon, Ānanda got up from his seat in Yanyan and went to the Buddha, bowed his head, saluted him with his palms together, and asked, "Does the monk want to know how much the earth moves?"

source_sentence: 佛語阿難：「有三因緣：一為地倚水上，水倚於風，風倚於空，大風起則水擾，水擾則地動。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "There are three causes and conditions: first, the ground leans on water, water leans on wind, and wind leans on air; when a great wind arises, the water is disturbed, and when the water is disturbed, the ground moves.

source_sentence: 二為得道沙門及神妙天，欲現感應故以地動。
translation: Second, it's because attained ascetics and the divine gods want to manifest a sensation so that the ground moves.

source_sentence: 三為佛力，自我作佛前後已動，三千日月萬二千天地無不感發，天人鬼神多得聞解。」
translation: Third, because of the power of the Buddha, which has moved since before and after I became a buddha, 3,000 suns, 2,000 moons, and 2,000 heavens and earth are not without sensation, and gods, humans, ghosts, and spirits often hear and understand them."

source_sentence: 阿難歎曰：「妙哉！
translation: Ānanda praised them, "Marvelous!

source_sentence: 佛為無倫，以自然法無不感動，至德至道巍巍乃爾。」
translation: The Buddha is unparalleled, unfailingly moved by natural dharmas, and majestic in his supreme virtue and ultimate path."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是如是。
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 佛德不小，乃從無數劫積累功德，奉行諸善自致作佛，有是神妙自然法化，一切知一切見，無不入無不化。
translation: The Buddha's virtue is not small; it's the accumulation of merit from countless eons, devotion to goodness that brings about Buddhahood on its own, and the miraculous natural transformation that has all knowables and all views that are not unobtainable and not untransformable.

source_sentence: 憶念我昔以慈悲心，若干百千人，天下諸王君子眾，化住相見，隨其像貌為安慰說經道，周流教化使得善意。
translation: Remembering that I once, with kindness and compassion, created hundreds of thousands of people, a multitude of kings and princes from around the world, lived and saw each other, spoke the sūtras and paths for comfort according to their appearance, and taught and transformed them in a way that made them have good intentions.

source_sentence: 如是現化，遍於八方，隨其國俗服飾語言，相其人行何法、知何經，而為演說授以正道，樂義言者為設典教，解道理者為說上要，堅立其志已而捨沒。
translation: Thus manifested, they would go from place to place, dress and speak according to the customs of their countries, discern what things their people practiced and what scriptures they knew, and then explain and teach them the right path, setting up scriptures and instructions for those who were comfortable speaking the truth, teaching the essentials for those who understood the principle, and abandoning them after they had established their resolve.

source_sentence: 設王君子莫知我誰，後皆耽味敬承法化，是為佛之清妙自然法也。
translation: Suppose a king or ruler doesn't know who I am and later they all savor and respect the teaching of the Dharma, which is the Buddha's pure, wonderful, and natural teaching.

source_sentence: 「又我，阿難！
translation: "And I, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 得佛力遍入現化以佛儀法，入沙門眾為之師導，已後化入梵志之眾。
translation: Attaining the Buddha's power, he entered the present life with the Buddha's rituals and methods, entered the community of ascetics as his teacher, and later transformed into the community of priests and scholars.

source_sentence: 又居士儒林異學，隨其被服聲音語言，授與經道一切成就，為錯橫法，已而捨歿，子曹皆受我教而莫我知，是佛之難有自然法也。
translation: Another layman, a Confucian layman, followed his clothing, voice, and speech, and gave him sūtras and paths that were completely accomplished, a wrong and wrong way, and then he left and died, and his children all received my teaching but didn't know about me.

source_sentence: 佛亦上入第一四天王，遍上第二忉利天，第三焰天，第四兜術天，第五不憍樂天，第六化應聲天，周印魔；又上第七梵天，第八梵眾天，第九梵輔天，第十大梵天，第十一水行天，第十二水微天，第十三水無量天，第十四水音天，第十五約淨天，第十六遍淨天，第十七清明天，第十八守妙天，第十九玄妙天，第二十福德天，第二十一慤淳天，第二十二近天，第二十三快見天，第二十四無結愛天，我皆周遍若干百千人。
translation: 佛亦上入第一四天王，遍上第二忉利天，第三焰天，第四兜術天，第五不憍樂天，第六化應聲天，周印魔；又上第七梵天，第八梵眾天，第九梵輔天，第十大梵天，第十一水行天，第十二水微天，第十三水無量天，第十四水音天，第十五約淨天，第十六遍淨天，第十七清明天，第十八守妙天，第十九玄妙天，第二十福德天，第二十一慤淳天，第二十二近天，第二十三快見天，第二十四無結愛天，我皆周遍若干百千人。

source_sentence: 是諸天隨形貌與相見，樂清淨者為說清淨，達道意者勸使布化，在清人者立以大，其解法情即授以要，誘勸導利化使得道訖輙捨歿，彼諸天輩莫知我誰，是佛之難有自然法也。
translation: These gods follow their forms and appearances, teaching purity to those who enjoy purity, encouraging and teaching those who have attained the goal of the path, establishing greatness in those who are pure, teaching the essentials to those who understand the feelings of the Dharma, inducing, encouraging, guiding, and guiding those who make the path end, and then abandoning death, so that none of the gods know who I am.

source_sentence: 上餘四天皆無形聲，故佛不往：第二十五空慧入天，第二十六識慧入天，第二十七不用慧入天，第二十八不想入天。
translation: The other four heavens have no form or sound, so the Buddha doesn't go there: the 25th heaven where wisdom enters emptiness, the 26th heaven where wisdom enters consciousness, the 27th heaven where wisdom enters without using, and the 28th heaven where he doesn't want to enter.

source_sentence: 「如是阿難！
translation: "Thus, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 佛恩廣大無不成，慘然而難值，佛出世間如漚波羅華時時有耳，佛所說法亦難聞聞，已聞經法當受護持。
translation: "Buddha's kindness is vast and unmatched, yet it's tragic and difficult to attain, for a Buddha who appears in the world like the utpala flower that comes into existence from time to time has ears, and whose teachings are difficult to hear and hear, so you must guard the sūtras and teachings you've heard.

source_sentence: 護持云何？
translation: How will it be upheld?

source_sentence: 我滅度後若有比丘言：『我見佛口受，是法、是律、是教。』
translation: 'After I die, if there's a monk who says, 'I've seen the Buddha receive this teaching by word of mouth, it's the teaching, and it's the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 然其言說不近不經而虧損法，當持法句、經所言、律所見，為解說之。
translation: Still, if his words don't approach the scriptures and undermine the teaching, he should take the words of the teaching, the words of the scriptures, and the views of the vinaya and explain them for others.

source_sentence: 若經不入與法意諍則當諫曰：『賢者且聽，佛不說是，吾子妄受；與法意違，非法非律，不如佛教，當知棄是。』
translation: If the sūtras don't enter into a dispute with the mind of the Dharma, then you should remonstrate, saying, 'Listen, good man, the Buddha doesn't say this, and my son has falsely accepted it; it's contrary to the mind of the Dharma, it's not the Dharma or the Vinaya, and it's not like Buddhism; you should know to discard it.'

source_sentence: 若有比丘言：『我所止得，依聖眾有法戒者面受，是法是律是教。』
translation: If a monk says, 'I've stopped short and accepted the precepts in the presence of a noble congregation that has the Dharma and the precepts, and this is the Dharma, the Vinaya, and the teaching,' then he says, 'That's not near or far from the Dharma.

source_sentence: 然其言說，不近不經虧損正法，當持法句、經義、律語，為解說之。
translation: However, his words don't approach the loss of the right teaching without the sūtras, so he should maintain the phrases of the teaching, the meanings of the sūtras, and the words of the vinaya and explain them for others.

source_sentence: 若經不入與法意諍則當諫謂：『賢者且聽，比丘眾者知法曉律。
translation: If the sūtras don't enter into a dispute with the mind of the Dharma, then you should remonstrate, saying, 'Listen, good man, that monk knows the Dharma and understands the Vinaya.

source_sentence: 此非法律，吾子妄受，不應於經與法意違，不如佛教，當知棄是。』
translation: This is not the Dharma, and my son has falsely accepted it; he shouldn't disagree with the sūtras and the Dharma; he's not like Buddhism; he should know better and abandon it.'

source_sentence: 若有比丘言：『我面從耆舊長老者口受，是法是律是教。』
translation: Suppose a monk says, 'I've personally received this from the mouth of an elderly man, and this is the teaching of the Dharma and the Vinaya.'

source_sentence: 然其言教不近不經虧損正法，當持法句、經義語，為解說之。
translation: Still, his words and teachings don't approach the scriptures and lose the true teaching, so he should maintain the phrases of the teaching and the words of the sūtras and explain them for them.

source_sentence: 若經不入與法意違則當諫謂：『賢者且聽，耆舊長老知法曉律，此非法律，吾子妄受；不應於經與法意違，不如律教，當知棄是。』
translation: If the sūtras don't agree with the teaching, then you should remonstrate, saying, 'Listen, good man, the elderly know the teaching and understand the vinaya, and this is not the teaching, which my son has accepted falsely; you shouldn't disagree with the sūtras and the teaching, and you shouldn't teach what's not the vinaya; you should know and discard it.'

source_sentence: 若有比丘言：『我得近賢才高明智達福慧眾所宗事面從受，是經法律教。』
translation: Suppose there's a monk who says, 'I've attained the ability to approach a worthy, highly intelligent, well-versed, and well-versed person who follows the tenets of the Dharma and accepts this as the teaching of the Dharma of the sutra.'

source_sentence: 然其言說不近不經虧損正法，當持法句義解說之。
translation: However, his words don't approach the true teaching without the loss of the sūtras, so he should explain the teaching with the meaning of the phrase of the teaching.

source_sentence: 若經不入與法意諍則當諫謂：『正賢者且聽，賢哲高明曉法律，此非法律，吾子妄受；不應於經與法意違，不如佛教，知棄是。』
translation: If the sūtras don't agree with the teaching, then you should remonstrate, saying, 'Listen, righteous person! A wise man who's highly intelligent knows the teaching, and this is not the teaching, which my son has falsely accepted; you shouldn't contradict the sūtras' meaning and the teaching's meaning and not follow Buddhism, knowing that you're abandoning it.'

source_sentence: 「又復阿難！
translation: "Again, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有言：『我得從佛受是法語。』
translation: "Suppose someone says, 'I'll receive this teaching from the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 而其言謬不合經法；若有言：『我從依聖眾奉法者受。』
translation: but their words don't match the teachings of the sūtras; or if they say, 'I'll receive it from someone who relies on the noble ones and serves the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 而其言謬不合經法；若復言：『我口從耆舊長老受是。』
translation: and their words are incorrect and don't match the teachings of the sūtras; and if they also say, 'I received this from an elder who's an elder by mouth.'

source_sentence: 其言錯謬不合經法；若言：『我從賢才高明智大福慧面受是語。』
translation: Their words are incorrect and don't match the sūtras' teaching; if they say, 'I received this from a wise, highly intelligent, and greatly fortunate and wise person.'

source_sentence: 而其言非、不合經法；當舉佛語以解曉之，趣使其人入經承律，以為詳說佛經法教，聖眾所承，長老所明，賢才所識，賢者諦受，如律教無得諍。
translation: Those words are not true and don't match the sūtras' teaching; they should be interpreted by citing the Buddha's words, and the person should be instructed to enter the sūtras and follow the vinaya in order to explain in detail the Buddha's teaching of the Dharma, which is accepted by noble people, understood by elders, known by wise people, and truly accepted by good people, just as the vinaya teaches, without being able to debate it.

source_sentence: 當知持是四。
translation: You should know that these are the four things to maintain.

source_sentence: 若彼，阿難！
translation: If that's the case, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 有是四暗，虧損正法，當為分別，令棄邪媚受四正意，是為受持護法者也。
translation: These four kinds of darkness are a violation of the right teaching, and they should be discerned so that they abandon wrong views and accept the four right intentions, which are to accept and protect the teaching.

source_sentence: 其不承經戒者，眾比丘當黜之，稊稗不去害善穀苗，弟子不善壞我道法，當相檢校，無得以佛去故不承用教。
translation: If someone doesn't uphold the sūtras and precepts, the monks will depose them, like tares that don't go away and harm the saplings of good grain or disciples who aren't good and corrupt the teaching of our path, and they will be examined by one another, for there's no way to get the Buddha to leave and therefore not uphold the teaching.

source_sentence: 世有沙門，奉行經戒，則天下得福，天神皆喜。
translation: If there are ascetics in the world who consecrate the sūtras and observe the precepts, the world will be blessed and the gods will rejoice.

source_sentence: 若聞在所，有明經比丘、長老比丘、新人學者，當從諮受；如是則清信之士、清信之女，樂供衣、食、牀臥、疾藥。
translation: If they hear that there are sūtra-educated monks, elder monks, or novice scholars in their place, they will consult them; thus, pure faithful men and pure faithful women will be happy to provide clothing, food, bedding, and medicine for illnesses.

source_sentence: 比丘同道，不可不和，其墮地獄三惡道者，皆不和故耳。
translation: A fellow monk on the same path can't be discordant; those who fall into the three evil destinies of hell are discordant.

source_sentence: 比丘不可轉相形笑言：『我知經多，汝知經少。』
translation: A monk mustn't turn from one to the other and laugh, saying, 'I know much about the sūtras, and you know little about them.'

source_sentence: 知多知少，各自行之。
translation: Each one knows more and knows less, so let's go his own way.

source_sentence: 言說應經者用，不合者棄，是佛所說，比丘所受，必善持之。
translation: This is what the Buddha teaches, what a monk accepts, and what he will well maintain.

source_sentence: 若令如後，凡講論經，當言：『聞如是。
translation: If he makes it so, whenever he speaks about the sūtras, he'll say, 'I've heard it this way.'

source_sentence: 一時佛在某國某處，與某比丘俱說是經。』
translation: One time, the Buddha was in a certain place in a certain country and spoke this sūtra with a certain monk.'

source_sentence: 若其經是，不得苟言非。
translation: If that sūtra is right, you mustn't say it's wrong.

source_sentence: 佛所說，相承用，如是者比丘法可得久住。」
translation: What the Buddha teaches is shared and applied, and thus the monk's teaching can be sustained for a long time."

source_sentence: 彼時，佛請賢者阿難，俱之波旬國，弟子皆行。
translation: The Buddha then invited the good man Ānanda to join him in the country of Pāpīyān, and his disciples all went along.

source_sentence: 佛以樂夫延，歷城中去，到止城外禪頭園中。
translation: The Buddha took Rājagṛha and went through the city to the Meditation Park outside of Pāpīyān.

source_sentence: 波旬豪姓有諸華氏，聞佛來到皆出作禮，稽首畢一面坐。
translation: When they heard that the Buddha had arrived, they all saluted, paid homage, and sat down at one side after prostrating themselves.

source_sentence: 佛告諸華氏：「智者居家，恭儉節用，所奉有四，用得歡喜。
translation: The Buddha told the Vātsīputrīya, "A wise person who lives at home and is respectful, frugal, and economical has four things to offer that make him happy.

source_sentence: 一為供養父母妻子，二為瞻視人客奴婢，三為給施親屬知友，四為奉事君天正神沙門道士。
translation: One is to support his father and mother and wife, two is to look after people's guests and servants, three is to give alms to relatives and friends, and four is to serve the ruling gods, the right spirit, ascetics, and priests.

source_sentence: 是謂知生全身安家，得力得色，富足名聞，死得上天。」
translation: This is called knowing that you'll be born whole and homebound, attain strength and form, become rich and famous, and go to heaven at death."

source_sentence: 佛為諸華氏說法正化若干要語，皆歡喜去。
translation: The Buddha spoke certain essential words of correct transformation to the Blossoms, and they all departed rejoicing.

source_sentence: 有華氏子淳，獨留，起整衣服，長跪白佛：「欲設微食，願與聖眾，俱屈威神。」
translation: One of the Blossoms, Jun, who was left alone, got up, adjusted his robes, and knelt down long enough to say to the Buddha, "I'd like to offer a small meal, and I'd like to join the noble people in bending their authority."

source_sentence: 佛以慈哀默而可之。
translation: The Buddha accepted it with kindness and silence.

source_sentence: 淳喜為禮而歸，調作濃美，嚴飾室內，晨敷牀座畢，行白佛：「食具已辦，唯聖知時。」
translation: Jun returned in joy and reverence, decorated his room with rich and beautiful preparations, spread out his seat in the morning, and said to the Buddha, "The meal is ready, but the sages know when it's ready."

source_sentence: 佛與弟子，俱到其舍，就高座於眾前坐，淳手自斟酌，奉鉢致漿。
translation: The Buddha and his disciples all went to his abode and sat down on a high seat in front of the crowd.

source_sentence: 有惡比丘，已欲取器，佛知之，淳念聖恩，善意供養，行澡水畢，取小牀坐佛前，說頌問曰：「請賢聖慈智，　　已度到彼岸，　法御為折疑，　　將幾沙門輩。」
translation: When a bad monk who wanted to take a container and the Buddha knew it, Jun remembered the noble's kindness, made offerings with good intentions, finished washing his body with water, took a small couch, sat down in front of the Buddha, and spoke a verse asking, "Please be wise and compassionate, for you've crossed over to the other side, and how many ascetics will the Dharma ruler cast doubt on?"

source_sentence: 佛告淳：「沙門有四，當識別之。
translation: The Buddha told him, "There are four ascetics, and you should identify them.

source_sentence: 一曰行道殊勝，二曰達道能言，三曰依道生活，四曰為道作穢。
translation: One is practicing the path with distinction, two is attaining the path and being able to speak it, three is living by the path, and four is making defilement of the path.

source_sentence: 何謂殊勝？
translation: What's meant by superior?

source_sentence: 佛所說法，不可稱量，能行無比，降心能度，憂畏為法，御導世間，是輩沙門為最殊勝。
translation: "When it comes to the Buddha's teachings, which are incalculable, unsurpassed in terms of what he can do, capable of subduing minds, making grief and fear the Dharma, and guiding the world, this group of ascetics is the most extraordinary.

source_sentence: 何謂能言？
translation: What's meant by being able to speak?

source_sentence: 佛所稱貴微妙之法，體解其情行之不疑，亦能為人演說道跡，是輩沙門，為愍能言。
translation: These are the group of ascetics who are able to speak compassionately about the subtle things that are valued by the Buddha, understand their feelings and conduct themselves without doubting them, and explain the path's steps for others.

source_sentence: 何謂依道？
translation: What's meant by relying on the path?

source_sentence: 念在自守，勤綜學業，一向不迴，孜孜無倦，以法自養，是輩沙門，為知生活。
translation: These are the group of ascetics who know life when they are mindful of their own discipline, assiduous in their training, never turning back, tireless in their efforts, and nurturing themselves with the teaching.

source_sentence: 何謂作穢？
translation: What's meant by making oneself unclean?

source_sentence: 恣意所樂，依恃種姓，專為穢行，為眾致議，不敬佛語，亦不畏罪，是輩沙門為道作穢；凡人見聞，將謂在道，學淨智者，如此而已。
translation: Such a group of ascetics who want what they want, rely on their lineage, engage in defiled behavior, give advice to the crowd, don't respect the Buddha's words, and aren't afraid of sins are those who make the path unclean; when ordinary people see and hear them, they'll say they're on the path, and those who train in pure cognition are just like that.

source_sentence: 當知是中，有真有偽，有善有惡，不可齊同以為一也。
translation: You should know that in this case, there's truth and falsity, good and evil, and they can't all be considered the same.

source_sentence: 彼不善者，為賢致謗，是故佛律，黜夫惡者，譬如苗中生草，不去害禾。
translation: Those who are unwholesome are denigrating the good for the sake of the good. Therefore, the Buddha's teaching is to dismiss those who are unwholesome like grass growing in the midst of seedlings that doesn't harm the grain.

source_sentence: 世多此輩，內懷穢濁，外如清淨，若知福者，信心奉道，終不為彼起恨想也。
translation: Many of these people in the world harbor internal impurity and external purity, but if they know what's good, they'll have faith and follow the path, and they'll never become hateful towards them.

source_sentence: 識善之人，修己遠惡除欲怒癡，故得道疾。」
translation: Those who know what's good cultivate themselves, distance themselves from evil, and rid themselves of desire, anger, and delusion; therefore, they attain speedy progress."

source_sentence: 佛說已，淳歡喜。
translation: After the Buddha spoke, he was overjoyed.

source_sentence: 般泥洹經卷上
translation: *Nirvana Sutra, Vol. 1
